**Fire Brand** is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is [unaligned](/wiki/Unaligned "Unaligned"), and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") type is a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword").

[Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand") is the [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold")-aligned counterpart of Fire Brand.

## Generation

Any long sword that is randomly generated on the ground has a base 1⁄20 chance (5%) of being made into an artifact, which has a 1⁄6 chance of being Fire Brand. Fire Brand can be given to any [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") as a [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift"), though it will never be the first one given.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Demonbane's base item is changed to a [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), so any long sword made into an artifact has a 1⁄5 chance to be made into Fire Brand.

## Description

While wielded, Fire Brand grants [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), has a +1d5 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") bonus and deals [double damage](/wiki/Double_damage "Double damage") against monsters without fire resistance - it may also destroy [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll"), [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook") and [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") in the target's open inventory.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 928677c8](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/928677c810fa56ee1b838238e6ee0d5ac13aae79), [engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") with Fire Brand will burn the message into the floor like a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire") without dulling the blade.

## Strategy

Though it is less popular than its counterpart Frost Brand due to many of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom")'s denizens being fire-resistant demons, and it can destroy valuable loot in a monster's inventory, Fire Brand is still a great artifact weapon throughout the game: it deals slightly more damage than [Grayswandir](/wiki/Grayswandir "Grayswandir") against non-resistant large monsters that do not hate [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver"). Fire Brand is also the stronger of the two on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), where most of the monsters present will resist cold damage but not fire damage.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As a result of [commit 928677c8](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/928677c810fa56ee1b838238e6ee0d5ac13aae79), Fire Brand can be used to reliably create a permanent [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") in a single turn.

## History

Fire Brand is introduced alongside Frost Brand in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

From [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0") to [NetHack 3.2.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.2.3 "NetHack 3.2.3"), Fire Brand is neutral-aligned - [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0") makes Fire Brand and Frost Brand unaligned.

## Messages

- The fiery blade \<hits/burns> \<monster>!

  Fire Brand was used to attack a monster, with "hits" used only if the target has fire resistance.

## Variants

[Variants](/wiki/Variants "Variants") of *NetHack* commonly make it possible to pair Fire Brand with Frost Brand in some manner.

### NetHack: The Next Generation

In [NetHack: The Next Generation](/wiki/NetHack:_The_Next_Generation "NetHack: The Next Generation"), Fire Brand is one of the artifacts that can be created by [Duri](/wiki/Duri "Duri") at [The Forge](/wiki/The_Forge "The Forge"), with a base price of 6500 (slightly lower than Frost Brand). This also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), Frost Brand and Fire Brand can be generated or [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for as any of the following:

- [Gauntlets](/wiki/Gauntlets "Gauntlets") (for [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk"))

- Any bladed weapon that is one-handed for medium-sized characters with the exception of:

  - Any [vibroweapon](/index.php?title=Vibroweapon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Vibroweapon (page does not exist)")
  - [Crow quill](/index.php?title=Crow_quill\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Crow quill (page does not exist)")
  - [Set of crow talons](/index.php?title=Set_of_crow_talons\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Set of crow talons (page does not exist)")
  - [Rakuyo](/wiki/Rakuyo "Rakuyo")
  - [Crystal sword](/wiki/Crystal_sword "Crystal sword")
  - [Runesword](/wiki/Runesword "Runesword")
  - [Mirrorblade](/wiki/Mirrorblade "Mirrorblade")

When given as a sacrifice gift, Fire Brand has a 1⁄3 chance of being created as a long sword, and will otherwise be created as one of the following, with an equal probability of each: a [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber"), a [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), [gauntlets](/wiki/Gauntlets "Gauntlets"), a [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword"), an [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), a [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), or an [athame](/wiki/Athame "Athame"). Any valid object that is randomly generated on the ground has the normal chance to be made into a Brand, but once either one has generated, the other can only be generated as the matching object type.

Fire Brand appears as an **ember-runed** variation of its base item, and has +1 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and deals double fire damage: the damage of its base dice is dealt as explosion damage, making it much harder to resist. Fire Brand does not resist being two-weaponed with Frost Brand and vice versa; while Fire Brand is wielded or worn, it also has 5⁄6 of the normal movement cost to attack with (10 vs. 12).

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), Fire Brand can be two-weaponed with Frost Brand.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), Fire Brand has its base item changed to a [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), and it can be [twoweaponed](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") with Frost Brand or [Mirror Brand](/wiki/Mirror_Brand_\(xNetHack\) "Mirror Brand (xNetHack)"). Fire Brand instantly kills [green slimes](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime") and flammable [golems](/wiki/Golem "Golem") upon hitting them.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), Fire Brand can generate as any one-handed sword weapon, and can be combined with Frost Brand at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") to create [Frostburn](/index.php?title=Frostburn\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Frostburn (page does not exist)").

### notdNetHack

In [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), in addition to dNetHack details, Fire Brand can generate as a crystal sword.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), Fire Brand has its base item changed to a [steel](/wiki/Steel "Steel") [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"). It can be combined with Frost Brand at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") to create [Dichotomy](/wiki/Dichotomy "Dichotomy"), an artifact [runesword](/wiki/Runesword "Runesword").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), Fire Brand has its base item changed to a steel short sword as in EvilHack, and can be used to burn engravings into the floor without dulling it.

### notnotdNetHack

In [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), in addition to notdNetHack details, Fire Brand can generate as any bladed weapon other than a vibroweapon or runesword.

## Encyclopedia

Some say the world will end in fire,  
Some say in ice.  
From what I've tasted of desire  
I hold with those who favor fire.  
But if it had to perish twice,  
I think I know enough of hate  
To say that for destruction ice  
Is also great  
And would suffice.

\[ Fire and Ice, by Robert Frost ]
